White Rhinoes: Najin, 32, is being dropped from the programme which aims to implant artificially developed embryos into another species of rhino. Fatu, her daughter, is now the only donor left #SaveTheRhino
#SayNoToPoaching #EndWildlifeCrime
Responding:
reuters.com
One of world's last two northern white rhinos dropped from race to save the species
One of the world's last two northern white rhinos, a mother and her daughter, is being retired from a breeding programme aimed at saving the species from extinction, scientists said on Thursday.

africageographic.com
The rhino Cryovault - frozen in time - Africa Geographic
The rhino Cryovault holds repositories of rhino DNA, gametes, and tissues preserved indefinitely - in case we fail to save our rhino.
Text:
While it may be impossible to freeze time, the Cryovault offers the next best thing – a way to ensure that, in the worst-case scenario, we can preserve some of the genetic legacies of our rhinos before they are lost forever-via 
@africageo
 |  https://shar.es/aoEBGi #Savetherhinoafricageographic.com

Comments: Did you know... Rhino horns are made from the same stuff as our fingernails which is keratin. Rhino horns continuously grow during their lifetime, where the white rhino’s horn can grow 7cm every year- and the record length is 150cm long! #savetherhino #conservation #antipoaching
Text: Did you know... Rhino horns are made from the same stuff as our fingernails which is keratin. Rhino horns continuously grow during their lifetime, where the white rhino’s horn can grow 7cm every year- and the record length is 150cm long! #savetherhino #conservation #antipoaching

At just 19 months old, this black rhino was orphaned due to poaching. Thanks to the Lowveld Rhino Trust, now - ten years later - she’s had her third calf! 
Find out more about the Trust's important monitoring work in our latest blog: https://lght.ly/fn1n6b8
#SaveTheRhino

Comments: How many species of rhinos are there in the world? Kenya is home to two; white and black rhinos. Did you know that the two species are actually grey in color?  Kenya also hosts the last known 2 northern white rhino females. #WildlifeKE #SaveTheRhino
Text: How many species of rhinos are there in the world? Kenya is home to two; white and black rhinos. Did you know that the two species are actually grey in color?  Kenya also hosts the last known 2 northern white rhino females. #WildlifeKE #SaveTheRhino

Rhinos, a mega-herbivore, are a keystone species who play an important role in ecosystems. Rhino grazing helps maintain savanna grasslands, which in turn supports numerous other species, and their extinction could be catastrophic.

Responding:
A very very stupid question! ..

"when I say #SaveTheRhino I don’t mean don’t save other animals. I’m stepping up for the rhino by putting a spotlight on its plight. If you respond to my #SaveTheRhino call with #SaveAllWildLife, you are unconsciously displacing that spotlight. "

This only works if your #SaveTheRhino organisation truly is interested in saving the rhino & doesn't have another agenda. Also I need to be able to participate out of my own free will & not be forced, attacked & vilified if I rather want to focus on the plight of the eliphant.
Totally agree with Prof Madonsela  HOWEVER If I don't participate in #SaveTheRhino rallies, does not mean I condone abuse of Rhinos or any other animal.

Remember that wonderful singing Sumatran rhino in #SevenWorldsOnePlanet? Well, it's her birthday: happy 4th birthday Delilah! 
In 2016, Delilah was the second rhino born at the Sumatran Rhino Sanctuary. She gives us hope for the future of her species! #savetherhino #sumatranrhino

A rare one-horned rhino has been killed as poaching attempts increase in one of India's best-known national parks during the coronavirus lockdown, officials said Sunday.

Comments: PSA: Rhino horns are made of keratin, the same stuff your fingernails & hair are made of. It doesn't cure disease or make small things bigger. Stop killing animals for it! Every day is #SaveTheRhino Day #conservation #rhino #rhinoceros

Comments: Absolutely heartbreaking - Sumatran ’s are no more. So much more to do to protect those that are left. #SaveTheRhino #AdoptAbetterfuture
Responding:
Quote Tweet
WWF UK
@wwf_uk
·
Nov 25, 2019
We’re heartbroken by the news that Sumatran rhinos in Malaysia are now extinct. 

We can’t let other species follow the same fate as Iman. We must do all we can to show our outrage about what is happening to our planet. #AdoptABetterFuture.

It's #FunFactFriday time!
Rhino pregnancies last forever! Or at least it might feel like it, they are pregnant for 15-16 months! Mother rhinos are very nurturing - the young stay with them until they are approximately 3 years old. #savetherhino
Text:
It's #FunFactFriday time!
Rhino pregnancies last forever! Or at least it might feel like it, they are pregnant for 15-16 months! Mother rhinos are very nurturing - the young stay with them until they are approximately 3 years old. #savetherhino

Comments: Did you know? When pregnant, the female #Rhino will carry its baby for up to 18 months before giving birth. They usually only give birth to one calf and twins are very rare. #savetherhino

Comments: Rhino horns are highly prized, estimated to fetch up to $60,000 per kilo on the black market - more than the price of gold or cocaine. Rhino horn is composed mainly of keratin, the same component as in human nails. #SavetheRhino from extinction.
Text:

Comments: There are five species of rhino, residing mainly in Africa and Asia. These include Africa's White Rhino and Black Rhino, and Asia's Greater One-horned Rhino, Sumatran Rhino and the extremely vulnerable Javan Rhino. They're all at Risk #SavetheRhino

This week a female rhino at Shamwari was killed by poachers & its horn removed. Every rhino lost to poachers is a tragedy. Shamwari has a dedicated anti-poaching team without which many more of these magnificent animals would be in danger. We’re working with the police.

Comments: Pangolin scales are made of keratin, the same protien that forms rhino horn. #WorldPangolinDay #SavethePangolin #SavetheRhino #EndangeredSpecies
Responding:
Quote Tweet
Wildlife Conservation Network
@wildnetorg
·
Feb 13, 2019
#WorldPangolinDay is this Saturday, so we want to share some facts about these scaly mammals! Their bodies are covered with overlapping scales made of keratin, the same protein that forms human hair, fingernails, and rhino horn. Learn more at @SavePangolins  Keith Connelly

Injecting poison into rhino's horns will protect them from poachers and kill the demand for rhino horn right at the source, which is prized as a medicinal Asian medicine.
Text:
How far would you go to stop #rhino #poaching? One pissed-off game manager outside of #Johannesburg , #SouthAfrica wants to do the unthinkable: inject poison into horns as a deadly warning to would-be poachers and the consumers who would buy them https://bit.ly/2uhxWh3 #Chinagreenworldwarriors.com
South Africa: Will Poisoning Horns Halt Rhino Poaching?
Injecting poison into rhino's horns will protect them from poachers and kill the demand for rhino horn right at the source, which is prized as a medicinal Asian medicine.

: Scientists Created Fake Rhino Horn. But Should We Use It?

Responding:
nytimes.com
Scientists Created Fake Rhino Horn. But Should We Use It? (Published 2019)
